conclusion: To find the magnitude of the induced electromotive force (EMF) in the coil, we can use Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction.
The induced EMF in a rotating coil in a uniform magnetic field is given by: \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \)
Where: - \( n \) is the number of turns of the coil, - \( B \) is the magnetic induction intensity, - \( A \) is the area of the coil, - \( \omega \) is the angular velocity, - \( t \) is the time.
Since timing starts when the coil plane passes through the neutral plane, at \( t = 0 \), the sine term is zero.
We are interested in the maximum induced EMF, which occurs when \( \sin(\omega t) = 1 \).
Calculate the Area of the Coil: \( A = l_{AB} \times l_{BC} = 0.2 \, \text{m} \times 0.5 \, \text{m} = 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \)
Substitute the Given Values: - \( n = 100 \) - \( B = 0.1 \, \text{T} \) - \( A = 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \) - \( \omega = 100\pi \, \text{rad/s} \)
Calculate the Maximum Induced EMF: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = n B A \omega \)
